citations.narrative:
The skunk has been relocated to a new enclosure since the last inspection. This new enclosure is located outside
of the existing compound perimeter fence, and does not have a perimeter fence of its own.
A 6 foot perimeter fence shall be erected at least 3 feet from this enclosure on all 4 sides. Alternatively, this
enclosure shall be relocated inside the existing perimeter fence.
Correct by December 1, 2017

Enclosure # 23 had an accumulation of old, wet, moldy, hay/leaf mixture on the elevated resting surface. Upon
further inspection of this hay mixture, it was discovered that the underlying wooden surface was wet, spongy,
deteriorating, and no longer structurally sound to safety support the weight of this serval.
If this bedding is being used on this type of wooden surface, it shall be changed more frequently to prevent moisture
buildup, mold, and deterioration
Correct by December 1, 2017
This inspection and exit interview were conducted with the licensee

narrative:
3.127(d)
FACILITIES, OUTDOOR. 
The skunk has been relocated to a new enclosure since the last inspection.  This new enclosure is located outside
of the existing compound perimeter fence, and does not have a perimeter fence of its own.
A 6 foot perimeter fence shall be erected at least 3 feet from this enclosure on all 4 sides.  Alternatively, this
enclosure shall be relocated inside the existing perimeter fence.
Correct by December 1, 2017
3.131(a)
SANITATION.   
Enclosure # 23 had an accumulation of old, wet, moldy, hay/leaf mixture on the elevated resting surface.  Upon
further inspection of this hay mixture, it was discovered that the underlying wooden surface was wet, spongy,
deteriorating, and no longer structurally sound to safety support the weight of this serval.
If this bedding is being used on this type of wooden surface, it shall be changed more frequently to prevent moisture
buildup, mold, and deterioration 
Correct by December 1, 2017
This inspection and exit interview were conducted with the licensee
